table_description: EMIR (European Market Infrastructure Regulation) Trade Activity Report containing derivatives trade data from EU markets. Contains 100,000+ trade records with 191 fields covering counterparty information, trade details, valuations, contract specifications, and regulatory compliance data. Use for: derivatives analysis, regulatory reporting, trade surveillance, counterparty risk analysis, market activity monitoring.

columns.message received timestamp: PRIMARY TIMESTAMP - When the trade message was received by the system (ISO 8601 format: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ). Use for message timing analysis.
columns.reporting timestamp: CRITICAL DATE FIELD - When the trade was officially reported to trade repository (ISO 8601 format). Use for date range queries on reporting activity.
columns.report submitting entity id: LEI (Legal Entity Identifier) of the entity submitting the report
columns.entity responsible for reporting: LEI of the legal entity responsible for trade reporting compliance
columns.nature of the counterparty 1: Type/nature of Counterparty 1 (F=Financial, N=Non-Financial, C=Central Counterparty, O=Other)
columns.country of the counterparty 2: ISO 2-letter country code of Counterparty 2 (e.g., NL=Netherlands, RO=Romania)
columns.direction: Trade direction from reporting party perspective (BYER=Buyer, SLLR=Seller)
columns.uti: UTI - Unique Transaction Identifier (globally unique trade ID)
columns.isin: ISIN code identifying the financial instrument
columns.contract type: Type of derivative contract (SWAP, OPTN=Option, FUTR=Future, FORW=Forward, etc.)
columns.asset class: MAJOR FILTER FIELD - Asset class of derivative (CURR=Currency, INTR=Interest Rate, EQUI=Equity, COMM=Commodity, CRDT=Credit)
columns.settlement currency 1: Settlement currency for leg 1 (ISO 3-letter code: EUR, USD, GBP, etc.)
columns.valuation amount: CRITICAL FINANCIAL FIELD - Current valuation/mark-to-market amount (stored as numeric string, CAST to DOUBLE for calculations)
columns.cleared: IMPORTANT STATUS - Whether trade was cleared through CCP (true/false). Use for cleared vs uncleared analysis.
columns.central counterparty: CCP identifier (e.g., LCH-GB, CME-US, DTCC-TIW-US, ICE-EU)
columns.venue of execution: MIC code of execution venue (XAMS=Amsterdam, XFRA=Frankfurt, etc.)
columns.execution timestamp: KEY DATE FIELD - When trade was executed/agreed (ISO format). Use for 'when did trades happen' queries.
columns.effective date: IMPORTANT DATE - Contract effective/start date (YYYY-MM-DD). Use for contract period queries.
columns.expiration date: IMPORTANT DATE - Contract expiration/maturity date (YYYY-MM-DD). Use for maturity analysis.
columns.notional amount of leg 1: KEY FINANCIAL FIELD - Notional/face value for leg 1 (numeric string, CAST to DOUBLE). Use for exposure analysis.
columns.notional amount of leg 2: Notional/face value for leg 2 (numeric string, CAST to DOUBLE)
columns.action type: REGULATORY FIELD - Type of action (NEWT=New Trade, MODI=Modification, EROR=Error, VALU=Valuation Update)
columns.event type: Type of lifecycle event (NOVA=Novation, COMP=Compression, UPDT=Update, CREV=Credit Event)
